ARABIC: وَلَئِن مَّسَّتْهُمْ نَفْحَةٌ مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ يَٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If even a single waft of the punishment were to touch them, they would say, 'Alas for us! We were indeed wrongdoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Even if a whiff of the Lord's chastisement were to touch them they would surely say: "Ah woe, alas, we were surely sinful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Were only the slightest whiff from your Lord's punishment to touch them, they would cry out: "Woe to us; we were indeed wrong-doers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: If a blast of the torment of your Lord strikes them, they will say, "Woe to us! We have been unjust people."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And if a whiff of your Lord’s punishment were to touch them, they would certainly say, “Woe to us – we were indeed unjust!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And if a breath of the torment of your Lord touches them, they will surely cry: "Woe unto us! Indeed we have been wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And if a blast of the chastisement of your Lord were to touch them, they will certainly say: O woe to us! surely we were unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: If but a breath of thy Lord's chastisement touched them, they would surely say, 'Alas for us! We were evildoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And if a breath of thy Lord's punishment were to touch them, they assuredly would say: Alas for us! Lo! we were wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: yet if even a breath of your Lord's punishment touched them, they would say, "Woe to us! We were indeed wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And if a breath of the torment of thy Lord were to touch them, they will say: woe unto us! we have been wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Should a whiff of your Lord’s punishment touch them, they will surely say, ‘Woe to us! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: If but a breath of the Wrath of thy Lord do touch them, they will then say, "Woe to us! we did wrong indeed!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And if a breath (minor calamity) of the Torment of your Lord touches them, they will surely cry: "Woe unto us! Indeed we have been Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But if just a breath of your Lord's punishment were to touch them, they would say: 'Woe for us, we were harmdoers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And when a breath of your Lord’s punishment touches them, they say, “Woe to us, we were truly wicked.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:46] And if a whiff, a slight instance, of your Lord’s chastisement were to touch them, they would indeed say, ‘O (yā, used for drawing attention [to something]) woe for us!, [O this is] our destruction! Truly we were doing evil’, in ascribing partners to God and denying [the Mission of] Muhammad (s).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And if a breath of thy Lord's punishment were to touch them, they assuredly would say: Alas for us! Lo! we were wrong-doers) against ourselves, and we were disbelievers in Allah.
